intro: Didymaea alsinoides var. australis, commonly known as the Australian alsinoid, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It is a member of the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or red. The plant has slender, branching stems and narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
